Container.Name: n8n-mcp-server
Container.Overview:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that empowers AI assistants to seamlessly interact with n8n workflows. This acts as a bridge, enabling AI assistants like Claude to programmatically manage and control n8n workflows and executions using natural language commands.
Features: - List, create, update, and delete workflows - Activate and deactivate workflows - Execute workflows on demand - View and manage workflow executions - Full n8n API access through MCP protocol
Prerequisites: - Running n8n instance with API access enabled - n8n API key (generate in n8n Settings > Personal) - Network connectivity between this container and n8n
Container.Requires: Requires a running n8n instance with API access enabled

Config.Name: n8n API URL
Config.Description: URL to your n8n instance API. If n8n is running in Docker, use the container name (e.g., http://n8n:5678/api/v1). For host-based n8n, use your server IP.

Config.Name: n8n API Key
Config.Description: Your n8n API key. Generate this in n8n under Settings > Personal > API Key

Config.Name: Webhook Username
Config.Description: Optional: Username for webhook authentication if your n8n instance requires it

Config.Name: Webhook Password
Config.Description: Optional: Password for webhook authentication if your n8n instance requires it

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Logging verbosity: error, warn, info, debug
